item.title: A pure CSS burger menu
item.author: gh@dbb.tools (Duncan Browne)
item.description: A pure CSS burger menu No JS, works on mobile! Just because it’s interesting, let’s make a burger menu, without using JS to handle hiding/showing the menu content. What’re we going to do? Set up a nav menu. Move that menu off the side of the viewport, so it can’t be seen. Add a hamburger icon to that nav menu that will remain on screen. When we hover (or tap on mobile), we’ll bring the menu back onto the screen, and hide the hamburger.
